data.title: More candy discounts ahead of Halloween, but consumers remain wary
data.description:
Retailers have been discounting candy ahead of Halloween to boost sales amid weaker consumer spending and still-high cocoa prices.

Halloween discounts on candy brands began earlier this year to draw consumers, and were deeper and covered more products than a year ago, Reuters reported, citing Datasembly.

Hershey (HSY) was among food companies with the highest volume of discounted products in the four weeks to October 4 compared to last year, according to a recent report by Jefferies.

In prepared remarks on Thursday, Hershey's (HSY) CEO Kirk Tanner said the Halloween season began slower than anticipated, likely influenced by warmer weather and more seasonal purchases in the final week due to Halloween occurring on a Friday.

Hershey (HSY) raised candy prices by double-digits on average this summer, although Halloween candy was not included in the price hike.

Candy is on average 10.8% more expensive this Halloween season compared to last year, according to an analysis from think tanks Groundwork Collaborative and The Century Foundation, citing NielsenIQ data.

"These price increases are a direct result of Trump's tariffs," the analysis noted, with most cocoa and cocoa products facing tariffs between 15% and 39%.

Mondelez (MDLZ) CEO Dirk Van de Put said some of the company's recent promotions have not been as effective as hoped, and sales slowed as consumers are "very concerned in general about the economy, frustrated with the pricing they're seeing."

data.title: Earnings Snapshot: T. Rowe Price Q3 beats EPS, but revenue misses amid $7.9B client outflows
NiSource launches $1.5 billion ATM equity offering program
data.description:
• NiSource (NI) announced a new at-the-market equity offering program allowing it to sell up to $1.5 billion of common stock through December 31, 2028.
  • Proceeds will be used for general corporate purposes, including capital spending, working capital, and debt repayment.
  • This program replaces the prior $900 million ATM offering from February 2024, which had about $47.5 million in unsold shares. NiSource has appointed Barclays, BMO, BNP Paribas, BofA, Goldman Sachs, J.P. Morgan, Mizuho, Morgan Stanley, MUFG, Scotia, and Wells Fargo as sales agents and forward sellers.
  • NI +1.28% premarket.
  • Source: Press Release

data.title: Nxera Pharma reports nine-month result
data.description:
• Nxera Pharma press release (SOLTF): Q3 Net loss totalled JPY 4,809 million (US$32.5 million) vs. a net loss of JPY 3,503 million (US$23.2 million) in the prior corresponding period.
  • Revenue totalled JPY 21,848 million (US$147.4 million*), a decrease of JPY 135 million (an increase of US$2.0 million) vs. the prior corresponding period.

data.title: Chevron beats Q3 earnings expectations, powered by record production after Hess deal
data.description:
Chevron (CVX) +0.2% pre-market Friday after comfortably beating estimates for Q3 adjusted earnings, as worldwide and U.S. oil-equivalent production set quarterly records, helped by the Hess acquisition.

Q3 net profit fell to $3.54 billion, or $1.82/share, from $4.49 billion, or $2.48/share, in the year-earlier quarter, and revenues slipped to $48.17 billion from $48.93 billion a year ago, primarily due to lower crude oil prices, severance costs and other transaction costs related to the Hess acquisition; Q3 adjusted profit totaled $3.6 billion, or $1.85/share, exceeding Wall Street expectations.

Chevron (CVX) said it incurred a net loss of $235 million due to severance and other transaction costs related to the Hess deal, which was completed in July.

Q3 capex was higher than a year ago largely due to spending on legacy Hess assets post-acquisition; affiliate capex was down primarily due to lower spending at TCO.

Cash flow from operations excluding working capital increased nearly 20% Y/Y to $9.9 billion, driven in part by production growth in areas including the Permian Basin and the U.S. Gulf, CFO Eimear Bonner said.

Q3 worldwide production rose 21% Y/Y to a company record 4.08 million boe/day, compared to standalone production of 3.4 million boe/day in the year-ago quarter, including a 27% Y/Y increase in U.S. production to a record 2.04 million boe/day.

Q3 U.S. upstream earnings fell to $1.28 billion from $1.42 billion in Q2, primarily due to lower liquids realizations and severance and other transaction costs related to the Hess acquisition, partly offset by impacts from higher sales volumes, while Q3 International upstream earnings rose to $2.02 billion from $1.31 billion in Q2, primarily due to lower affiliate earnings, lower realizations, and asset sales, partly offset by earnings from legacy Hess, primarily Guyana.

Q3 U.S. downstream earnings rose to $638 million from $404 million in Q2, primarily due to higher margins on refined product sales and lower operating expenses, partly offset by lower earnings from 50%-owned Chevron Phillips Chemical joint venture, while Q3 International downstream earnings rose to $499 milllion from $333 million in Q2, primarily due to favorable foreign currency effects, partly offset by lower margins on refined product sales.

Benchmark Brent crude prices averaged $68.17/bbl in Q3, down 13% Y/Y and up 2% Q/Q.

data.title: Carlyle Credit Income Fund commences convertible share offering
data.description:
• Carlyle Credit Income Fund (CCIF) has entered into a purchase agreement with certain institutional investors for the purchase and sale of around 17,500 shares of the fund’s 7.25% Series E convertible preferred shares due 2030, liquidation preference $1,000.00 per share.
  • The fund expects to receive net proceeds (before expenses) from the sale of around $16.275 million. The offering is expected to close on or about October 30, 2025.
  • Starting May 1, 2026, the fund may choose to redeem some or all of the convertible preferred shares at any time, using legally available funds. The redemption price will equal the liquidation preference plus any accumulated but unpaid dividends (without interest) up to the redemption date.
  • The shares pay a quarterly dividend at a fixed annual rate of 7.25% of the liquidation preference, or $72.50 per share, per year.
  • Source: Press Release

data.title: Charter Communications GAAP EPS of $8.34 misses by $0.95, revenue of $13.7B misses by $50M
data.description:
• Charter Communications press release (CHTR): Q3 GAAP EPS of $8.34 misses by $0.95.
  • Revenue of $13.7B (-0.7% Y/Y) misses by $50M.
  • Third quarter total Internet customers declined by 109,000. As of September 30, 2025, Charter served 29.8 million Internet customers.
  • Third quarter total mobile lines increased by 493,000. As of September 30, 2025, Charter served 11.4 million mobile lines.
  • As of September 30, 2025, customer relationships totaled 31.1 million, excluding mobile-only relationships.
  • Third quarter revenue of $13.7 billion declined by 0.9% year-over-year, driven by lower residential video and advertising sales revenues. Residential connectivity revenue grew 3.8% year-over-year.
  • Net income attributable to Charter shareholders totaled $1.1 billion in the third quarter.
  • Third quarter Adjusted EBITDA1 of $5.6 billion declined by 1.5% year-over-year.
  • Third quarter capital expenditures totaled $3.1 billion and included $1.0 billion of line extensions.
  • Third quarter net cash flows from operating activities totaled $4.5 billion, compared to $3.9 billion in the prior year.
  • Third quarter free cash flow1 of $1.6 billion was consistent with the prior year period as lower cash taxes and a more favorable working capital benefit year-over-year were offset by higher capital expenditures.
  • During the third quarter, Charter purchased 7.6 million shares of Charter Class A common stock and Charter Communications Holdings, LLC ("Charter Holdings") common units totaling $2.2 billion
  •
